definition: (of news) to spread/to get around
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
biography/historical narrative/commentaries/relay station

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: The rumors spread throughout the school very soon.
sentences.chinese: 谣言很快就在学校里传开了。

sentences.english: From then on the custom of worshiping the moon spread among the people.
sentences.chinese: 从那时起，敬拜月亮的风俗就在民间流传开来。

sentences.english: Since then, the custom of Mid-Autumn Festival worship in private spread.
sentences.chinese: 从此，中秋节拜月的风俗在民间传开了。

sentences.english: the secret was spread among the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 奥秘在人群傍边流传开来。

sentences.english: It's been bruited abroad that she's going to get married.
sentences.chinese: 她要结婚的消息四处传开了。

sentences.english: Word of Benson's demise spread quickly among her pursuers.
sentences.chinese: 本森辞世的消息迅速在她的追求者中传开。

sentences.english: The news that living Buddha has come got abroad in this small village.
sentences.chinese: 活佛来了的消息在这个小村庄传开了。

sentences.english: It spread through the Internet, sparking a number of South Korean public discontent.
sentences.chinese: 这件事经互联网传开，激起众多韩国民众不满。

sentences.english: As news of Marco's riches got about, many Venetians started for China.
sentences.chinese: 当马可致富的消息传开，许多威尼斯人开始出发中国。

sentences.english: Word spread about his ramen, and the restaurant was always busy.
sentences.chinese: 关于他的拉面的消息传开了，餐馆总是很繁忙。

sentences.english: I was not go to the dance, neither did Yin Ling.
sentences.chinese: 令我们欣慰的是，谣言没有流传开来。

sentences.english: The campaign soon spread to other parts of the country.
sentences.chinese: 献花行动很快在其他地区传开。

sentences.english: Gossip about this harelipped baby has been spreading.
sentences.chinese: 关于这个兔唇婴儿的流言已经传开了。

sentences.english: The story of that Homeric fight got all around town.
sentences.chinese: 那场荷马式的大战立刻在全城镇里传开了。

sentences.english: Henceforth, Paise is that a "bright city " praise has spread over.
sentences.chinese: 此后，佩斯是一个“光明城市”的赞誉就传开了。

sentences.english: The news that there is going to be a wonderful concert this evening has spread.
sentences.chinese: 今天晚上将有一场精彩的音乐会的消息传开了。

definition: to spread widely
to get round fast/to spread like wildfire
news pass quickly from mouth to mouth (idiom)/an infectious disease spreads quickly (old meaning)
pinyin: yi1 chuan2 shi2 , shi2 chuan2 bai3

definition: it is rumored that
to discuss spiritedly (idiom)/tongues are wagging
huge waves/(fig.) ruckus/controversy/sensation
see 盡人皆知|尽人皆知[jin4 ren2 jie1 zhi1]
to cause a sensation/to create a stir in (a place)/commotion/controversy
to spread/to circulate/to hand down
known by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
bubbling and gurgling/hubbubing/abuzz
to listen/to hear what sb says/news one has heard
to comment/to talk about/to discuss/discussion/CL:個|个[ge4]
to spread/to disperse/to disseminate
known to everyone
variant of 嘩然|哗然[hua2 ran2]
in uproar/commotion/causing a storm of protest/tumultuous
